resources.string: Grass cutting is an effective way to promote growth and keep your lawn looking great. It’s important, though, to make sure you’re mowing properly, as it can either help or hurt your lawn depending on how it is done. Many problems with lawns are caused, simply, by poor mowing practices — mowing too short, mowing with dull blades, mowing infrequently, or cutting too much at once.

When it comes to hedge and shrub maintenance, you can look at regular care —such as pruning shrubs, trimming shrubs, trimming bushes, and trimming hedges— as a chore or you can look at it as a creative outlet. Many new gardeners don’t feel they are up to the task of trimming hedges and put it off. Rather than put off hedge and shrub maintenance, it’s much better if you start pruning shrubs right away when they are young and then continue to do minor annual pruning each year. If you allow them to become overgrown, they’ll end up needing major renewal pruning. Pruning shrubs regularly also helps promote healthier shrubs that produce more blooms.
